page.title: 04PINES GARDENS
page.content: The Pines Gardens are just over 6 acres of land which are to be preserved as open space. They were previously owned by a family who left the Pines house and 3 acres of land derelict and ugly. Mr.and Mrs.Cleary(founders of the St.Margaret's Bay Trust)had a dream of just how the Pines Garden could look. First of all the site had to be purchased and cleared.Then in 1970 work was started.In 1971 they were officially opened and in 1972 a large statue,by the sculptor Oscar Nemon,of Sir Winston Churchill was erected in the gardens facing the White Cliffs of Dover.The statue was unveiled by Sir Winston's grandson-Mr.Winston Churchill. This statue was the finishing piece to Mr. Cleary's dream-The{Pines {Gardens.}
